Ugh Apple just rejected Comm's new build with ETH log-in.

They're claiming Ethereum counts as a "third-party login service" and insisting that we add Sign in with Apple support. https://i.imgur.com/pPx0R9z.png

I've seen some apps with ETH log-in that don't have Apple log-in, including Farcaster. Wondering how those apps have navigated these requirements.

 any advice?
Yeah, that's what we do (web view that pops up as a bottom sheet) but Apple didn't like it...

Pulling up on this thread hella late, but we‚Äôre working on this  

Telegram launched with E2EE and rolled it back early on. I actually think it‚Äôs more about product tradeoffs.

Moxie (Signal guy) said as much in his web3 essay. E2EE will be limited to simple Signal-like apps until users can host servers.

Here‚Äôs Pavel Durov (Telegram founder) on why Telegram isn‚Äôt E2E encrypted

https://telegra.ph/Why-Isnt-Telegram-End-to-End-Encrypted-by-Default-08-14

And here‚Äôs Moxie on why E2E encrypted apps can‚Äôt reach Telegram-level functionality without personal servers

https://moxie.org/2022/01/07/web3-first-impressions.html

We‚Äôre doing an early beta right now ‚Äì can I DM you?

My bad RE the bio, will add a landing page link (comm.app)

Pulling up on this thread hella late, but we‚Äôre working on this problem at  

Unlike Matrix we‚Äôre fully E2E-encrypted. We also avoid third-party-hosted homeservers, in favor of self-hosted servers (we call them keyservers)

We‚Äôre launching in mid-May - would love to chat if this sounds interesting!

The success of personal AI assistants is predicated either on a surveillance state where the AI knows everything, or the proliferation of local-first private AI models that run on personal servers. Big part of why we‚Äôre working on personal servers at
Huge for Europe. https://www.theregister.com/2024/02/15/echr_backdoor_encryption/

Hey all! I‚Äôm Ashoat, the founder of Comm ().

We're building a sovereign Discord alternative by using personal servers to extend Signal's model of E2E encryption (https://comm.app).

We‚Äôre looking for feedback from network staters ‚Äî if you‚Äôre down for a demo, drop a üëã or DM me!

Hey all! I‚Äôm Ashoat, the founder of Comm ().

We're building a sovereign Discord alternative by using personal servers to extend Signal's model of E2E encryption (https://comm.app).

We‚Äôre looking for feedback from privacy maxis ‚Äî if you‚Äôre down for a demo, drop a üëã or DM me!

Hear you on reliability / uptime. Comm keyservers are basically just a webserver + database + load balancer + Redis cache, all of which can be implemented in the cloud with replication for the simple stuff (eg. webserver) and managed services for the complicated stuff (eg. AWS RDS for the DB)

We plan to make this sort of reliable/scalable cloud setup available via Terraform and (maybe) AWS Marketplace. It‚Äôs a bad fit for a privacy-focused project, but a good fit for a large community that just wants sovereignty over the data

Ultimately this isn‚Äôt the same as a network of volunteer-hosted nodes‚Ä¶ that would ideally get you the best of both worlds, privacy and scale. But it‚Äôs harder to build for‚Ä¶ we can‚Äôt just rely on a SQL database as a black box.

We‚Äôve kicked around the idea of volunteer-hosted nodes, along with some sort of utility token that would incentivize / compensate the volunteers. It won‚Äôt be something we have ready for launch, but it‚Äôs definitely something we‚Äôre thinking about.

https://security.apple.com/blog/imessage-pq3/

Apple announces that iMessage E2E encryption is now ‚Äúpost-quantum‚Äù

Kind of an academic concern for now, but the premise is that it will protect users in the future if somebody collects a bunch of ciphertext now and uses a quantum attack on it later

The larger the gc gets the harder it gets to scale with sovereignty / privacy in mind

Working on solving this at  with personal servers handling hosting. No limit and we do have message pinning

Hey stumbled upon this thread 9 months later. Trying to integrate Coinbase Wallet via Rainbowkit, and created a patch to pass in enableMobileWalletLink via wagmi

It successfully deep links into Coinbase Wallet, but nothing shows up once we‚Äôre there

Check out this smooth af Farcaster login experience we‚Äôve been working on at  for our iOS/Android apps

Details and source in replies

The biggest issue we had to deal with is that iOS doesn‚Äôt let WebViews redirect to another app unless there‚Äôs explicit user action (like pressing a button)

Naive solutions are opening the WebView right away and having the button there, or having two buttons. We didn‚Äôt like either

We solved by this rendering an invisible WebView when the user presses the natively-rendered Farcaster login button

Instead of redirecting, that WebView passes the redirect link to the native layer, which then handles opening Warpcast itself

Check out the React Native source here: https://github.com/CommE2E/comm/blob/22957a398ef9ca442373e56720dc48486a1db82f/native/account/registration/connect-farcaster.react.js

In particular you'll want to look into the FarcasterWebView component
Farcaster has nodes but no personal server concept. Until homomorphic encryption is solved, personal servers are a necessary component of any privacy-preserving app architecture

I actually think these are the most important use cases on the list

blockchain solved sovereign identity, but sovereign data isn't really possible yet (at least for full-featured apps on par with web2)

this is only getting to get more and more important with the advent of AI

As a dev focused on data sovereignty & privacy, it often bewilders me how much Urbit is focused on things like Hoon, Nock, OS-level stuff, VMs, etc.

I will never understand why Urbit people feel like they need to invent not just one but TWO new programming languages

Imagine just how much further along their vision would be if Urbit was just built on top of like, Linux and Rust
Yeah that‚Äôs fair, Urbit has always been more of a research / passion project than a practical thing

I‚Äôm super excited about the potential for AI agents to automate tasks, but it also keeps me up at night. What happens to individual agency?

Feels likely we‚Äôll end up with one or two AI agents that have everyone‚Äôs data and are informing everyone‚Äôs decisions

At what point are we all just subsumed into the borg?

But the reality is that they are way behind the tech. TG ‚Äúsecret chats‚Äù don‚Äôt even support group chats, web, or desktop
